TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ServiceConfig extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies and configures the services that are to be active in the domain which is entered when calling or creating an . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceDomain.Enter%2A> and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Activity.%23ctor%2A> allow you to use the services configured by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig> with no need to tie those services to a component.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, setting the properties to configure the desired services.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig>.
|Item|Description| |----------|-----------------| |`Binding`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.BindingOption.NoBinding>| |`BringYourOwnTransaction`|`null`| |`COMTIIntrinsicsEnabled`|`false`| |`IISIntrinsicsEnabled`|`false`| |`Inheritance`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.InheritanceOption.Inherit>| |`IsolationLevel`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel.Any>| |`PartitionId`|A zero GUID.| |`PartitionOption`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.PartitionOption.Ignore>| |`SxsDirectory`|`null`| |`SxsName`|`null`| |`SxsOption`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SxsOption.Ignore>| |`Synchronization`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SynchronizationOption.Disabled>| |`ThreadPool`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ThreadPoolOption.None>| |`TipUrl`|`null`| |`TrackingAppName`|`null`| |`TrackingComponentName`|`null`| |`TrackingEnabled`|`false`| |`Transaction`|<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionOption.Disabled>| |`TransactionDescription`|`null`| |`TransactionTimeout`|The system default|

Docs.exception: is not supported on the current platform.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::BindingOption Binding { System::EnterpriseServices::BindingOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::BindingOption value); };
member this.Binding : System.EnterpriseServices.BindingOption with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the binding option, which indicates whether all work submitted by the activity is to be bound to only one single-threaded apartment (STA).
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.Binding%2A> has no impact on the multithreaded apartment (MTA). This property is used to set the thread pool binding only when creating a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Activity>. An error is returned if an attempt is made to set the thread pool binding when calling <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceDomain.Enter%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Transactions::Transaction ^ BringYourOwnSystemTransaction { System::Transactions::Transaction ^ get(); void set(System::Transactions::Transaction ^ value); };
member this.BringYourOwnSystemTransaction : System.Transactions.Transaction with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a that represents an existing transaction that supplies the settings used to run the transaction identified by .
Docs.value: A . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.BringYourOwnSystemTransaction%2A> (BYOT) identifies a transaction that supplies the context for the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig> transaction. When you bring your own transaction, that transaction's settings override the other transaction settings in the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig> object. The default value for <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.BringYourOwnTransaction%2A> is `null`.
For more information on BYOT, see <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.BYOT>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::ITransaction ^ BringYourOwnTransaction { System::EnterpriseServices::ITransaction ^ get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::ITransaction ^ value); };
member this.BringYourOwnTransaction : System.EnterpriseServices.ITransaction with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a that represents an existing transaction that supplies the settings used to run the transaction identified by .
Docs.value: An . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.BringYourOwnTransaction%2A> (BYOT) identifies a transaction that supplies the context for the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig> transaction. When you bring your own transaction, that transaction's settings override the other transaction settings in the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig> object. The default value for <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.BringYourOwnTransaction%2A> is `null`.
For more information on BYOT, see <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.BYOT>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool COMTIIntrinsicsEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.COMTIIntrinsicsEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether COM Transaction Integrator (COMTI) intrinsics are enabled.
Docs.value: if COMTI intrinsics are enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enables passing context properties from the COMTI into the context for this class. The COMTI eases the task of wrapping mainframe transactions and business logic as COM components.
Configures the COMTI intrinsics for the work that is done. The COMTI eases the task of wrapping mainframe transactions and business logic with transactions.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IISIntrinsicsEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IISIntrinsicsEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether Internet Information Services (IIS) intrinsics are enabled.
Docs.value: if IIS intrinsics are enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Enables passing IIS context properties, such as an application session object or a user session object, into the context for this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::InheritanceOption Inheritance { System::EnterpriseServices::InheritanceOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::InheritanceOption value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to construct a new context based on the current context or to create a new context based solely on the information in .
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionIsolationLevel IsolationLevel { System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionIsolationLevel get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionIsolationLevel value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the isolation level of the transaction.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A new transaction is created if the enclosing transaction is not running at the specified isolation level. <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.IsolationLevel%2A> is ignored if the enclosed code would not otherwise run in a transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Guid PartitionId { Guid get(); void set(Guid value); };
member this.PartitionId : Guid with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID for the COM+ partition that is to be used.
Docs.value: The GUID for the partition to be used. The default is a zero GUID.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::PartitionOption PartitionOption { System::EnterpriseServices::PartitionOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::PartitionOption value); };
member this.PartitionOption : System.EnterpriseServices.PartitionOption with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how partitions are used for the enclosed work.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SxsDirectory { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SxsDirectory : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the directory for the side-by-side assembly for the enclosed work.
Docs.value: The name of the directory to be used for the side-by-side assembly. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Configures side-by-side assemblies for this <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig>.
You must set the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.SxsDirectory%2A> property, if you create a new side-by-side assembly by setting the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.SxsOption%2A> property to <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SxsOption.New>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SxsName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SxsName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the side-by-side assembly for the enclosed work.
Docs.value: The file name of the side-by-side assembly. The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::SxsOption SxsOption { System::EnterpriseServices::SxsOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::SxsOption value); };
member this.SxsOption : System.EnterpriseServices.SxsOption with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how to configure the side-by-side assembly.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::SynchronizationOption Synchronization { System::EnterpriseServices::SynchronizationOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::SynchronizationOption value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value in that indicates the type of automatic synchronization requested by the component.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::ThreadPoolOption ThreadPool { System::EnterpriseServices::ThreadPoolOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::ThreadPoolOption value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the thread pool which runs the work submitted by the activity.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TipUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TipUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Transaction Internet Protocol (TIP) URL that allows the enclosed code to run in an existing transaction.
Docs.value: A TIP URL. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.TipUrl%2A> is similar to the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.BringYourOwnTransaction%2A> property but allows the enclosed code to run as an existing transaction that is specified by a TIP URL.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TrackingAppName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TrackingAppName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a text string that corresponds to the application ID under which tracker information is reported.
Docs.value: The application ID under which tracker information is reported. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because no component is associated with this tracker property, tracker activity is reported as arising from a component with the name specified by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.TrackingAppName%2A>.
For more information, see <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.TrackingEnabled%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TrackingComponentName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TrackingComponentName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a text string that corresponds to the context name under which tracker information is reported.
Docs.value: The context name under which tracker information is reported. The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TrackingEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TrackingEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether tracking is enabled.
Docs.value: if tracking is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The tracker is a reporting mechanism used by monitoring applications to watch running COM+ components. It is the reporting mechanism behind the spinning component icons in the Component Services administrative tool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption Transaction { System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how transactions are used in the enclosed work.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TransactionDescription { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TransactionDescription : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name that is used when transaction statistics are displayed.
Docs.value: The name used when transaction statistics are displayed. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a description if not provided, the value of <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServiceConfig.TrackingComponentName%2A> is used to describe the transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int TransactionTimeout { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.TransactionTimeout : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the transaction time-out for a new transaction.
Docs.value: The transaction time-out, in seconds.
